function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Potential risk of contagious disease transmission through interaction with neighbors in communal green spaces.","Impact":"Increased risk of spreading contagious diseases, such as COVID-19, among older adults in communal green spaces.","Mitigation":"Implement strict social distancing measures and guidelines for interaction in communal green spaces. Promote the use of face masks and hand hygiene.","Technologies":"Contact-tracing apps for monitoring interactions and potential exposure. Online communication platforms for virtual social interaction.","People":"Older adults (>60 years) living in areas with communal green spaces.","Owner":"Local community organizations, public health authorities, and residents."},{"Description":"Risk of vitamin D deficiency among older Scottish adults due to decreased sunlight exposure.","Impact":"Higher prevalence of vitamin D deficiency, which can affect overall health and immune function in older adults.","Mitigation":"Encourage outdoor activities and safe exposure to sunlight while following public health guidelines. Provide vitamin D supplements where necessary.","Technologies":"UV index monitoring apps for safe sun exposure. Telemedicine for remote consultation and prescription of supplements.","People":"Older Scottish adults.","Owner":"Healthcare providers, public health authorities, and individuals."},{"Description":"Risks associated with the potential spread of contagious diseases in domestic gardens.","Impact":"Increased risk of disease transmission in domestic garden settings, especially in densely populated areas.","Mitigation":"Regular cleaning and disinfection of frequently touched surfaces. Promotion of outdoor activities with household members only.","Technologies":"Outdoor air quality monitors for assessing the safety of the outdoor environment. Remote gardening assistance apps for virtual guidance.","People":"Households, especially those with older adults.","Owner":"Individual households, local gardening associations, and public health authorities."}]}
